attributes.action: Provide dedicated funding for smaller GP surgeries
attributes.additional_details: We value our local surgeries. The personal relationships and continuity of GP care we have is the bedrock of the NHS. I am sad to see smaller surgeries closing, which might force patients into large collective practices where they may not benefit from such a personal relationship with or have the same level of access to their General Practitioner, rather than other healthcare professionals. We accept that some areas will choose and benefit from a collective model, but we believe it should be allowed to co-exist with the traditional general practice model. I don't think the public has been consulted adequately.
attributes.background: I want the Government to provide dedicated and adequate funding for smaller GP surgeries, to ensure that these services remain open.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

signatures_by_constituency.mp: Rt Hon Alex Chalk KC MP
signatures_by_constituency.name: Cheltenham
